questions.question_text: Which service profile is affected if the default host firmware policy in Cisco UCS Manager is changed?

discussion.content:
C should be the answer.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Firmware-Mgmt/3-1/b_UCSM_GUI_Firmware_Management_Guide_3_1/b_UCSM_GUI_Firmware_Management_Guide_3_1_chapter_011.html
C correct

Selected Answer: C
C is the one..

Selected Answer: C
If you update the default host firmware package, you might cause the upgrade of firmware on unassociated servers and on servers with associated service profiles that do not include a host firmware package.

choices.D: any service profile that is not in the root sub-org
choices.A: any service profile that uses the global-default host firmware policy
choices.B: any service profile that uses a user-created host firmware policy
choices.C: any service profile that has no host firmware policy defined

questions.question_text: An engineer is implementing Cisco Intersight in a secure environment. The environment must use LDAP directory service and ensure information integrity and confidentiality. Which two steps must be taken to implement the solution? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Add a trusted root LDAP certificate to Cisco Intersight
choices.A: Enable Certificate Signing Request in Cisco Intersight
choices.E: Add a trusted OAuth token to Cisco Intersight
choices.D: Add a self-signed LDAP certificate to Cisco Intersight

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Enable Encryption—You must enable Encryption to secure the communication over the LDAP server. If encryption is enabled, a trusted root certificate has to be added. For more information, see Adding Certificates.

Selected Answer: BC
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/Intersight/b_Cisco_Intersight_Appliance_Getting_Started_Guide/b_Cisco_Intersight_Appliance_Install_and_Upgrade_Guide_chapter_0110.html#task_cl1_1pd_qkb:~:text=Enable%20Encryption%E2%80%94You%20must%20enable%20Encryption%20to%20secure%20the%20communication%20over%20the%20LDAP%20server.%20If%20encryption%20is%20enabled%2C%20a%20trusted%20root%20certificate%20has%20to%20be%20added.%20For%20more%20information%2C%20see%20Adding%20Certificates.

Selected Answer: BC
B and C...

Selected Answer: A
A is the one!

Selected Answer: A
The default key ring certificate must be manually regenerated if the cluster name changes or the certificate expires.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/cli/config/guide/2-0/b_UCSM_CLI_Configuration_Guide_2_0/b_UCSM_CLI_Configuration_Guide_2_0_chapter_0110.html#task_7052CA63F06F49D29F58D6BA1CF99993

choices.C: Reboot the SSO component of the Cisco UCS Manager
choices.B: Reinstall the cluster to generate the default key ring certificate
choices.D: Generate a new default key ring certificate from the Cisco UCS Manager
choices.A: Regenerate the default key ring certificate manually

questions.question_text:
Due to a domain name change at a customer site, a Cisco UCS cluster must be renamed. An engineer must recommend a solution to ensure that the Cisco UCS
Manager is available over HTTPS.
Which action accomplishes this goal?

discussion.content: Correct for me is B

I vote for B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/CLI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/3-2/b_Cisco_UCS_Manager_CLI_Administration_Mgmt_Guide_3_2/b_Cisco_UCS_Manager_CLI_Administration_Mgmt_Guide_3_2_chapter_01011.html#task_4704260519853629974

Selected Answer: B
Right answer is B.

Selected Answer: B
B is the one

Selected Answer: B
create backup scp://user@host35/backups/all-config9.bak all-configuration

Example
The following example shows how to create a disabled all-configuration backup operation for hostname host35 and commit the transaction:

UCS-A# scope system
UCS-A /system* # create backup scp://user@host35/backups/all-config9.bak all-configuration disabled
Password: 
UCS-A /system* # commit-buffer
UCS-A /system # 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/CLI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/3-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Manager_CLI_Administration_Mgmt_Guide_3_1/b_Cisco_UCS_Manager_CLI_Administration_Mgmt_Guide_3_1_chapter_01010.html

Selected Answer: B
UCS-A# scope system
UCS-A /system* # create backup scp://user@host35/backups/all-config9.bak all-configuration

Answer is B

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/CLI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/3-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Manager_CLI_Administration_Mgmt_Guide_3_1/b_Cisco_UCS_Manager_CLI_Administration_Mgmt_Guide_3_1_chapter_01010.html
should be B.

questions.question_text: An engineer needs to make an XML backup of Cisco UCS Manager. The backup should be transferred using an authenticated and encrypted tunnel, and it should contain all system and service profiles configuration. Which command must be implemented to meet these requirements?

discussion.content: I love these questions from topics which are not covered in the official guide...

B is correct 
uRPF = Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding has two modes - Strict and Loose
- Strict Mode = Reachable-via RX = Check routing-table AND need to be the same interface to reach the source.
- Loose Mode = Reachable-via ANY = Only check the routing-table
B is correct.

B is correct. 
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/resources/unicast_reverse_path_forwarding

The ip verify unicast source reachable-via rx command enables Unicast RPF in strict mode. To enable loose mode, administrators can use the any option to enforce the requirement that the source IP address for a packet must appear in the routing table.

questions.answer_description:
The ג€ip verify unicast source reachable-via rxג€ command enables Unicast RPF in strict mode. To enable loose mode, administrators can use the any option to enforce the requirement that the source IP address for a packet must appear in the routing table.
Reference:
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/cisco/view/62014-exam-350-601-topic-1-question-13-discussion/
